snippet: The convoy of around 260 trucks came within miles of the Ukrainian border on Thursday but was diverted to a Russian military base near Kamensk-Shakhtinsky.
abstract: Russian aid convoy of about 260 trucks, believed to be under direction of Russian military, comes within miles of the Ukrainian border before turning off onto dirt road near Russian military base in Kamensk-Shakhtinsky; international concern is mounting that the convoy will escalate the bloody but relatively confined civil war in eastern Ukraine into a broader conflagration.

byline.original: By ANDREW ROTH and ANDREW HIGGINS
byline.contributor: Andrew Roth reported from Kamensk-Shakhtinsky, and Andrew Higgins from Kiev, Ukraine. Neil MacFarquhar contributed reporting from Moscow, and Andrew E. Kramer from Donetsk, Ukraine.

lead_paragraph: The convoy of around 260 trucks came within miles of the Ukrainian border on Thursday but was diverted to a Russian military base near Kamensk-Shakhtinsky.

headline.main: Russian Convoy Draws Stern Warning From Ukraine and Stops Short of Border
headline.print_headline: Russian Convoy Draws Stern Warning From Ukraine and Stops Short of Border
